# Mosque- Based Social Services

  

## More Than Just a Place to Pray

Many mosques offer social services that uplift the entire community, including both Muslims and non- Muslims in need.

  

### Services Offered

From free meals to financial aid, mosques act as community hubs that meet real- world needs.

>"My mosque helped me pay rent after I lost my job, They didn't ask for anything in return,' said Ahmed, a father of three.

  

- Food drives and clothing donations

- Zakat (charity) distribution

- Immigration and legal aid clinics

- Health fairs and wellness checks

The East Plano Islamic Center in Texas is a great example of mosque based services. In addition to being a vibrant place of worship, EPIC actively engages in community service. The mosque regularly hosts food drives, free health screenings, and blood donation events. During times of crisis- such as a natural disasters or the COVID-19 pandemic- EPIC has partnered with local organizations to provide aid to affected families, regardless of their faith. These initiatives reflect the mosques commitment to serving not just its congregation, but the wider community as well!

![East Plano Islamic Center donation](https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/starlocalmedia.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/7/34/7346ddbe-6001-11e7-9505-13445501543b/595a5e1d1dd44.image.jpg?resize=698%2C500)

  

### Community Trust

These programs are run by volunteers, often through partnerships with local non- profits or city services.

![Volunteers distributing food](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
